name: Five Nights at Paite's Cancelled Build
name_original: Five Nights at Paite's Cancelled Build
description:
"Five Nights At Paite's offers the tried and true formula of FNAF with a unique twist, mixing an interesting art style with comedic quips, FNAP aims to be a fun new FNAF fan-game that hopefully does something original.

Coming Soon

STORY:

You've been kidnapped.

You've woken up in an unfamiliar building, unsure what to do, you've just been told by the culprit that you must survive his 'game' for five nights straight. Losing results in death, can you survive?

GAME FEATURES:

  • A unique 2D art style with interesting character designs.
  • New game mechanics unique to Five Nights at Paite's.
  • Endless night mode with GameJolt Scoreboard rankings.

SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS:

  • A CPU that can process things (really doesn't matter too much but at least have 2 cores)
  • 256 MBs RAM at the very minimum
  • DX11 compatible GPU
  • Windows 7 or higher

FOR THOSE ON MAC OR LINUX:

There isn't much else I can say beyond using something like wine to run the game on your OS since I don't currently have any plans to create official Mac or Linux ports of FNAP, sorry but that's just kinda how it is."

At least that was the original description for this game, unfortunately I decided to cancel the game so it will no longer be developed, I do have a build of the game that you can play though. It has all of the main nights playable alongside an unlockable (though unfinished) additional night.

While this is cancelled, it is arguably a lot more complete than anything else I have uploaded here, there is stuff missing, placeholder assets are used a bunch still like with the jumpscares, Edgy Paite's design was never finished, etc. I'm sure there's still some entertainment that can be taken out of this game though.

Oh right before I go, since this is a Clickteam game you can find the save file in %appdata% (specifically in the MMFApplications folder). If you type DebugOn=1 into the file (or input up+down+left+right on the warning screen) it'll turn on a special debug mode I created for play testers with this mode enabled:

  •  Pressing the numbered keys while in-game moves characters 
  • You can change the AI level of the characters in-game 
  • When you press '#' you can enter a separate menu with extra settings.

Finally, I will eventually release the MFA file for this game, there's some stuff I need to sort out first but yeah thanks for reading please download the game thankey.
